content:
7. Motion in Two Dimensions (Projectile Motion)
Projectile motion is the motion of an object thrown into the air, subject to gravity.

The path is a parabola.
The horizontal motion is uniform (constant velocity).
The vertical motion is uniformly accelerated (due to gravity).
8. Solved Examples and Previous Year Questions
Practicing solved examples and previous year questions helps understand the application of these concepts. For instance, solving a projectile motion problem involves breaking it into horizontal and vertical components and applying the equations of motion.
